p: Proanthocyanidins, naturally occurring compounds, were found highly in cinnamon bark, especially in C. wilsonii and C. burmannii with peak area percentages of 21.99% and 12.08%, respectively. Coumarin and cinnamyl alcohol were also major compounds with peak area percentages of 1.97%–7.31% and 0.41%–6.06%. ( E)‐Cinnamaldehyde and ( Z)‐cinnamaldehyde processing peak area percentages of 52.48%–82.62% were most important compounds in ethanol extracts. The compositions of ethanol extracts were different among each other, but the major compounds were not varied significantly as n‐butane extracts.
